result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Da Vion Turner

defendant.name: Turner, Da Vion
defendant.address: 218 N Main St Apt 21, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with criminal case settlement and elements

Cases 15CF334, 15CF340, 15CM314 and 15CM368 called together at 2:01 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Da Vion Turner in court, in-custody, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #3-15CM368, Counts #2 & #6-15CF334 & Counts #1 & #6-15CF340; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining Counts in 15CM368, 15CF334 & 15CF340 and Case 15CM314

15CM368-Ct#3, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, concurrent, with conditions:
15CF334-Ct#2 & Ct#6, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
15CF340-Ct#1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, concurrent, with conditions:
15CF340-Ct#6, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail (Ct#2-15CF334), with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence forthwith
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No contact with Arriana Winters unless approved and authorized by Agent
--No acts/threats of violence
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Complete certified batterer's Intervention Programming
--No possession of any dangerous weapon
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharges
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay pay domestic abuse surcharge (15CF334-Ct#2)

Days credit for time already served: 45 days
-15CM368
Days credit for time already served: 1 day-15CF334
Days credit for time already served: 5 days-15CF340

Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 2:27 pm
Sent to Defendant, For Cases 15CM368, 15CM314, and 15CF340 (1) NOH for 12/1/15 Plea/Sentencing//Defendant in Custody at JCJ

Cases 15CF334, 15CF340, 15CM314 & 15CM368 called together at 2:50 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Da Vion Turner in court, in-custody, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Dahnert: Very close to plea/sentencing, request the Court set as soon as possible as the State is not prepared to move forward today. Will be a joint recommendation as soon as the last detail is ironed out. 

On Motion to Modify Bond: Arguments presented
Court presents basis and denies motion to modify bond
Recess: 2:58 pm 

NEXT: ALL CASES: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing 12/1/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notices (misdemeanor files are already set for FSSC on this date/time)

Defendant's NOH's 1) Pretrial Conference 11/4/15 2) Status Conference 11/20/15 3) FSSC for 15CM368 & 15CM314 on 12/1/15  with attached scheduling order 4) FSSC for 15CF340 1/5/16 with attached scheduling order 5) Jury Trial for 15CM368 & 15CM314 on 12/7/15 6) Jury Trial for 15CF340 1/11/16

Mailed to 218 N. Main St. Apt 21 Fort Atkinson
Returned Not deliverable as addressed unable to forward
Court's Response to Def. 10/28/15 Letc: Request will be considered at 11/20/15 STC
Letter from the defendant requesting bond modification

Cases 15CF334, 15CF340, 15CM314 & 15CM368 called at 9:13 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Da Vion Turner in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CF334 & 15CF340:
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Turner waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files informations

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

15CM368:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial DEMANDED by the Defendant

Court requires a $500 cash bond with conditions:
-No contact with Arianna Winter or Nicole Wellman
-No acts/threats of violence
-No presence at 218 N. Main St. Fort Atkinson
-Booking

15CF334 & 15CM314: On State's Motion to Modify Bond; Arguments by Counsel
Court presents basis and grants State's motion to modify bond and requires
a $1000 cash bond to cover 15CF334, 15CM314 & 15CF340 ($200 already posted) with conditions:
-no acts/threats violence
-no contact with Arianna Winters or Marissa Zache
-No possession or consumption of alcohol

SPEEDY TRIAL DEMANDED ON ALL CASES
Recess: 9:39 am 

NEXT: ALL CASES: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 11/4/15 at 3:40 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 11/20/15 at 2:30 pm - Send notices 
15CM314 & 15CM368: (1) Schedule FSSC 12/1/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 12/7/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices
15CF334 & 15CF340: (1) Schedule FSSC 1/5/16 at 1:30 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 1/11-12/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Original Bond Document received from JESO on 9/4/15

Case called at 1:20 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Da Vion Turner appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Dahnert informs the Court that Mr. Turner is eligible for SPD Representation
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No presence at 218 N. Main St. Fort Atkinson
X  EXCEPTION - The Defendant shall be allowed presence at the address above on one occasion to obtain personal belongings if it is done upon reasonable notice and conditioned upon supervision by a law enforcement officer.
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No acts or threats of violence  
-No contact with Arriana Winters or Marissa Zache
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
Recess: 1:28 pm

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 9/23/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 10/16/15 at 11:00 am - Send notices
